messages.inProgress: Your priority processing request (20-10207) is in progress.
messages.expired: Your saved priority processing request (20-10207) has expired. If you want priority processing, please start a new request.
messages.saved: Your priority processing request has been saved.

savedFormMessages.notFound: Please start over to apply for priority processing request.
savedFormMessages.noAuth: Please sign in again to continue your application for priority processing request.

title: Request priority processing for an existing claim
subTitle: Priority processing request (VA form 20-10207)

preparerTypePage.title: Which of these best describes you?

preparerType.ui:title: Which of these best describes you?

labels.veteran: I’m a Veteran. I’m requesting priority processing for my claim.
labels.non-veteran: I’m not a Veteran, but I have an existing VA claim. I’m requesting priority processing for my claim.
labels.third-party-veteran: I’m a third-party representative or power of attorney. I’m requesting priority processing on behalf of a Veteran.
labels.third-party-non-veteran: I’m a third-party representative or power of attorney. I’m requesting priority processing on behalf of a non-Veteran with a VA claim (also called the claimant).

props.trigger: Who can sign on behalf of someone else?

children: (a family member or other assigned person who is not a power of attorney, agent, or fiduciary) requesting VA records for someone else, we must have an authorization form on record (VA Form 21-0845) for us to release their information.

props.children: Go to VA Form 21-0845 Authorization to Disclose Personal Information to a Third-Party (opens in new tab)
If you’re a power of attorney

children: requesting VA records for someone else, we must have an official record that you were appointed as their representative (VA Form 21-22 or VA Form 21-22a).

props.children: Go to VA Form 21-22 Appointment of Veterans Service Organization as Claimant’s Representative (opens in new tab)
Go to VA Form 21-22a Appointment of Individual as Claimant’s Representative (opens in new tab)

thirdPartyType.ui:title: How are you representing the Veteran?

labels.representative: I’m a third-party representative filling this out for the Veteran.
labels.power-of-attorney: I’m an authorized power of attorney for the Veteran.

props.trigger: Who can be a third-party representative or a power of attorney?

children: can be a family member or designated person filling out this form for a Veteran or someone with a claim. We consider you to be a third-party representative if you’re not already a power of attorney, agent, or fiduciary.

props.children: If you’re a third-party representative, we must have an authorization (VA Form 21-0845) on record.
Go to VA Form 21-0845 Authorization to Disclose Personal Information to a Third-Party (opens in new tab)

children: can fill out this request for the person with the claim. If you’re a power of attorney, we must have one of these records on file:

props.children: Go to VA Form 21-22 Appointment of Veterans Service Organization as Claimant’s Representative (opens in new tab)
Go to VA Form 21-22a Appointment of Individual as Claimant’s Representative (opens in new tab)

thirdPartyType.ui:title: How are you representing the person with a claim?

labels.representative: I’m a third-party representative filling this out for the person with a claim.
labels.power-of-attorney: I’m an authorized power of attorney for the person with a claim.

livingSituation.ui:title: Which of these statements best describe your living situation?

OVERNIGHT.ui:title: I live or sleep overnight in a place that isn’t meant for regular sleeping. This includes a car, park, abandoned building, bus station, train station, airport, or camping ground.

SHELTER.ui:title: I live in a shelter (including a hotel or motel) that’s meant for temporary stays.

FRIEND_OR_FAMILY.ui:title: I’m staying with a friend or family member, because I can’t get my own home right now.

LEAVING_SHELTER.ui:title: In the next 30 days, I will have to leave a facility, like a homeless shelter.

LOSING_HOME.ui:title: In the next 30 days, I will lose my home. (Note: This could include a house, apartment, trailer, or other living space that you own, rent, or live in without paying rent. Or it could include a living space that you share with others. It could also include rooms in hotels or motels.)

OTHER_RISK.ui:title: I have another housing risk not listed here.

NONE.ui:title: None of these situations apply to me.

livingSituation.ui:title: Which of these statements best describe the Veteran’s living situation?

OVERNIGHT.ui:title: The Veteran lives or sleeps overnight in a place that isn’t meant for regular sleeping. This includes a car, park, abandoned building, bus station, train station, airport, or camping ground.

SHELTER.ui:title: The Veteran lives in a shelter (including a hotel or motel) that’s meant for temporary stays.

FRIEND_OR_FAMILY.ui:title: The Veteran is staying with a friend or family member, because the Veteran can’t get my own home right now.

LEAVING_SHELTER.ui:title: In the next 30 days, the Veteran will have to leave a facility, like a homeless shelter.

LOSING_HOME.ui:title: In the next 30 days, the Veteran will lose their home. (Note: This could include a house, apartment, trailer, or other living space that you own, rent, or live in without paying rent. Or it could include a living space that they share with others. It could also include rooms in hotels or motels.)

OTHER_RISK.ui:title: The Veteran has another housing risk not listed here.

NONE.ui:title: None of these situations apply to the Veteran.

livingSituation.ui:title: Which of these statements best describe the claimant’s living situation?

OVERNIGHT.ui:title: The claimant lives or sleeps overnight in a place that isn’t meant for regular sleeping. This includes a car, park, abandoned building, bus station, train station, airport, or camping ground.

SHELTER.ui:title: The claimant lives in a shelter (including a hotel or motel) that’s meant for temporary stays.

FRIEND_OR_FAMILY.ui:title: The claimant is staying with a friend or family member, because the claimant can’t get their own home right now.

LEAVING_SHELTER.ui:title: In the next 30 days, the claimant will have to leave a facility, like a homeless shelter.

LOSING_HOME.ui:title: In the next 30 days, the claimant will lose their home. (Note: This could include a house, apartment, trailer, or other living space that you own, rent, or live in without paying rent. Or it could include a living space that they share with others. It could also include rooms in hotels or motels.)

OTHER_RISK.ui:title: The claimant has another housing risk not listed here.

NONE.ui:title: None of these situations apply to the claimant.

otherHousingRisks.ui:title: Tell us about other housing risks you are experiencing

props.trigger: What to know before sharing details about other housing risks

props.children: We understand that you may have other housing risks not listed here. If you feel comfortable sharing more about your situation, you can do that here. Or you can simply check this option and not include any details. We’ll use this information only to prioritize your request.

children: If you need help because of domestic violence, call the National Domestic Violence hotline
) or text "START" to 88788. Staff are there to help 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. All conversations are private and confidential.

otherHousingRisks.ui:title: Tell us about other housing risks the Veteran is experiencing

props.trigger: What to know before sharing details about other housing risks

props.children: We understand that the Veteran may have other housing risks not listed here. If you feel comfortable sharing more about their situation, you can do that here. Or you can simply check this option and not include any details. We’ll use this information only to prioritize the request.

children: If the Veteran needs help because of domestic violence, call the National Domestic Violence hotline
) or text "START" to 88788. Staff are there to help 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. All conversations are private and confidential.

props.trigger: What to know before sharing details about other housing risks

props.children: We understand that the claimant may have other housing risks not listed here. If you feel comfortable sharing more about their situation, you can do that here. Or you can simply check this option and not include any details. We’ll use this information only to prioritize the request.

children: If the claimant needs help because of domestic violence, call the National Domestic Violence hotline
) or text "START" to 88788. Staff are there to help 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. All conversations are private and confidential.

mailingAddressYesNo.ui:title: Do you have a current mailing address?

ui:errorMessages.required: Select yes if you have a current mailing address. Select no if you do not have a current mailing address.

labels.Y: Yes, I have a current mailing address.
labels.N: No, I don’t have a current mailing address.

ui:options.hint: If we have a way to contact you, we’ll be able to process this request faster. But we don’t require a mailing address for this request.

otherReasons.ui:title: Which of these descriptions is true for you?

ALS.ui:title: I have ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis), also known as Lou Gehrig’s disease.

VSI_SI.ui:title: I have a status from the Defense Department of Very Seriously Injured or Ill (VSI) or Seriously Injured or Ill (SI).

FORMER_POW.ui:title: I’m a former prisoner of war (POW).

MEDAL_AWARD.ui:title: I’m a Medal of Honor or Purple Heart award recipient.
